column1: My wife just woke me up to tell me... wait. june is over? you must be... julying.
column3: Julying is a play on the word july, representing both the month and as a pun on lying.
column4: The month of July is known for its warm weather and summer festivities.
column5: He was caught julying about his whereabouts last night.

column1: Why was the password a bad attorney? he was case sensitive!
column3: Case refers to both a legal case and letters being uppercase or lowercase (case-sensitive).
column4: The lawyer presented a strong case to the jury.
column5: Please make sure your documents are in upper and lower case as required for submission.

column1: What do a feminist and a broken atm have in common? they both cant make any change.
column3: Change refers to coins/currency and the act of making a difference or alteration.
column4: The change from the vending machine was not enough to buy a snack.
column5: Its important to advocate for change in societal norms.

column1: What do you call a politically powerful shrub in jamaica? a hegemon.
column3: Hegemon refers to a leading or dominant force or partner, and it also plays with the idea of a home (an informal term for a small plant).
column4: The country emerged as a hegemon in the region, influencing many others.
column5: The small hegemon in the garden thrived despite the harsh weather conditions.

column1: What do you call a pig that knows karate? a pork chop.
column3: Chop means to cut (as in meat) and it also refers to a martial arts move.
column4: I bought some pork chop for dinner tonight.
column5: She delivered a swift chop to the board during her karate practice.
